url: https://voicecollab.ai/fhir/PlanDefinition/VbaiPlanDefinitionVoiceExample

version: 0.1.0

title: Voice Cohort Protocol

status: active

date: 2023-04-28

publisher: KinD Lab

contact: KinD Lab: http://fhir.kindlab.sickkids.ca

description: This is a plandefinition for Voice cohort protocol

action

prefix: 1.1 - 1.8

title: Required task across all chorts

description: List of tasks and actions done across all 5 cohorts

priority: routine

definition: https://voicecollab.ai/fhir/PlanDefinition/VbaiPlanDefinitionExample

action

prefix: B

title: Patient Questionnaire

description: Questions for the patient to answer

priority: routine

definition: Patient Questions

action

prefix: B.2

title: VHI-10

description: Have patient complete VHI-10 Questionnaire

priority: routine

definition: VHI-10

action

prefix: B.3

title: CAPE-V

description: Have patient complete CAPE-V

priority: routine

definition: CAPE-V Questionnaire

action

prefix: B.4

title: Voice Disorders

description: Acoustic Tasks specific to voice cohort ​

priority: routine

Actions

-PrefixTitleDescription
*B.4 Task 1Prolonged vowel (1)Relax, take a deep breath, and sustain the sound “ah” for as long aspossible.
*B.4 Task 2Prolonged vowel (2)Chant the numbers 1 through 3 and say “ah” for 3-5 seconds.
*B.4 Task 3Sentences CAPE-VPlease read the sentences on your screen: 1. The blue spot is on the key again 2. How hard did he hit him? 3. We were away a year ago. 4. We eat eggs every easter. 5. My mama makes lemon muffins. 6. Peter will keep at the peak
*B.4 Task 4Connected speech passage Reading 'Rainbow passage'Please read the passage on your screen: When the sunlight strikes raindrops in the air, they act as a prism and form a rainbow. The rainbow is a division of white light into many beautiful colors. These take the shape of a long round arch, with its path high above, and its two ends apparently beyond the horizon.
*B.4 Task 5Pitch range & intensityUsing the sound 'e', glide from your lowest pitch possible to the highest pitch possible. Rest, take a breath and then glide from your highest pitch possible to the lowest pitch possible.

action

prefix: B.5

title: PMHx and Confounders specific to voice cohort

priority: routine

action

prefix: B.6

title: Validated questionnaires specific to voice cohort 

priority: routine

Actions

-PrefixTitleDescriptionPriorityDefinition[x]
*B.7.2Overall Voice Problem severity scale Administer Voice Problem Severity QuestionnaireroutineVoice Problen Severity

action.title: Voice Disorders
action.description: Acoustic Tasks specific to voice cohort ​

action.title: Prolonged vowel (1)
action.description: Relax, take a deep breath, and sustain the sound “ah” for as long aspossible.

action.title: Prolonged vowel (2)
action.description: Chant the numbers 1 through 3 and say “ah” for 3-5 seconds.

action.title: Sentences CAPE-V
action.description:
Please read the sentences on your screen: 1. The blue spot is on the key again 2. How hard did he hit him? 3. We were
away a year ago. 4. We eat eggs every easter. 5. My mama makes lemon muffins. 6. Peter will keep at the peak

action.title: Connected speech passage Reading 'Rainbow passage'
action.description:
Please read the passage on your screen: 
When the sunlight strikes raindrops in the air, they act as a prism and form a rainbow. The rainbow is a division of white light into many beautiful colors. These take the shape of a long round arch, with its path high above, and its two ends apparently beyond the horizon.

Using the sound
'e', glide from your
lowest pitch
possible to the
highest pitch
possible. Rest, take
a breath and then
glide from your
highest pitch
possible to the
lowest pitch
possible.
